channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Note on the coincidence of two henselisations
item.description: arXiv:2411.18186v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We compare two henselisations of a residually discrete valuation domain. Our constructive proof that a certain natural morphism is an isomorphism is also a proof in classical mathematics. Although this isomorphism is implicitly accepted as obvious in the literature, it seems that no proof was previously available.
item.dc:creator: Mar\'ia Emilia Alonso Garc\'ia (UCM), Henri Lombardi (LMB), Stefan Neuwirth (LMB)

item.title: Identifying Partitions with maximum commuting orbit $Q=(u,u-r)$
item.description: arXiv:2411.18340v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The authors here show that the partition $P_{k,l}(Q)$ in the table $\mathcal T(Q)$ of partitions having maximal nilpotent commutator a given stable partition $Q$, defined in [IKVZ2], is identical to the analogous partition $P_{k,l}^Q$ defined by the authors in [BIK] using the Burge correspondence.
item.dc:creator: Mats Boij, Anthony Iarrobino, Leila Khatami

item.title: Expressive Power of Infinitary Logic and Absolute co-Hopfianity
item.description: arXiv:2309.16997v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Recently, Paolini and Shelah have constructed absolutely Hopfian torsion-free abelian groups of any given size. In contrast, we show that this is not necessarily the case for absolutely co-Hopfian groups. We use the infinitary logic to show that there are no absolute co-Hopfian abelian groups above the first beautiful cardinal. An extension of this result to the category of modules over a commutative ring is given.
item.dc:creator: Mohsen Asgharzadeh, Mohammad Golshani, Saharon Shelah

item.title: An exploration of connections and curvature in the presence of singularities
item.description: arXiv:2411.04829v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We develop the notions of connections and curvature for general Lie-Rinehart algebras without using smoothness assumptions on the base space. We present situations when a connection exists. E.g., this is the case when the underlying module is finitely generated. We show how the group of module automorphism acts as gauge transformations on the space of connections. When the underlying module is projective we define a version of the Chern character reproducing results of Hideki Ozeki. We discuss various examples of flat connections and the associated Maurer-Cartan equations. We provide examples of Levi-Civita connections on singular varieties and singular differential spaces with non-zero Riemannian curvature. The main observation is that for quotient singularities, even though the metric degenerates along strata, the poles of the Christoffel symbols are removable.
item.dc:creator: Hans-Christian Herbig, William Osnayder Clavijo Esquivel
